abstract: Sam Roberts reviews books Gateway to Freedom: The Hidden History of the Underground Railroad by Eric Foner and The City Lost and Found: Capturing New York, Chicago and Los Angeles, 1960-1980 by Katherine A Bussard, Alison Fisher and Greg Foster-Rice.
lead_paragraph: A book by a Columbia University historian on New York’s integral role in the Underground Railroad, and another which invokes artistic expression to vividly recreate a gritty and pivotal era of urban tumult.
snippet: A book by a Columbia University historian on New York’s integral role in the Underground Railroad, and another which invokes artistic expression to vividly recreate a gritty and pivotal era of urban tumult.
